<denchmark-h:h2>Python LineIterator should return pixel coordinates</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>The python version of the LineIterator should return the pixel coordinates of the pixels along the line. The current implementation only returns the pixel values. There are many reasons for this:
1. Adding the pixel coordinates will make the python version more closely match the C version of this function. 2. Knowing the pixel coordinates is much more powerful. It will let you retrace the exact pixel path returned. 3. It will let you compute distances between pixels in the returned path without having to do a costly and approximate manhattan distance to euclidean distance conversion. </denchmark-code>
